title: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)
description: Stratifies severity of depressive episodes in adults using 10 core mood symptoms, particularly sensitive to treatment-induced changes.

parameters.name: apparent_sadness
parameters.description: Apparent sadness - representing despondency, gloom and despair reflected in speech, facial expression and posture

parameters.name: reported_sadness
parameters.description: Reported sadness - representing reports of depressed mood, regardless of whether it is reflected in appearance or not

parameters.name: inner_tension
parameters.description: Inner tension - representing feelings of ill-defined discomfort, edginess, inner turmoil, mental tension mounting to panic, dread, or anguish

parameters.name: reduced_sleep
parameters.description: Reduced sleep - representing the experience of reduced duration or depth of sleep compared to the subject's own normal pattern when well

parameters.name: reduced_appetite
parameters.description: Reduced appetite - representing the feeling of loss of appetite compared with when well

parameters.name: concentration_difficulties
parameters.description: Concentration difficulties - representing difficulties in collecting one's thoughts mounting to incapacitating lack of concentration

parameters.name: lassitude
parameters.description: Lassitude - representing difficulty getting started or slowness in initiating and performing everyday activities

parameters.name: inability_to_feel
parameters.description: Inability to feel - representing the subjective experience of reduced interest in the surroundings, or activities that normally give pleasure

parameters.name: pessimistic_thoughts
parameters.description: Pessimistic thoughts - representing thoughts of guilt, inferiority, self-reproach, sinfulness, remorse and ruin

parameters.name: suicidal_thoughts
parameters.description: Suicidal thoughts - representing the feeling that life is not worth living, that a natural death would be welcome, suicidal thoughts, and preparations for suicide

result.name: madrs_score
result.description: MADRS total score ranging from 0-60 points

ranges.interpretation: Normal mood or minimal depressive symptoms that do not significantly impact functioning.
Mild depression with some impact on daily functioning but generally manageable symptoms.
Moderate depression with significant impact on functioning requiring treatment intervention.
Severe depression with major impairment in functioning requiring intensive treatment and monitoring.

references: Montgomery SA, Asberg M. A new depression scale designed to be sensitive to change. Br J Psychiatry. 1979;134:382-9. doi: 10.1192/bjp.134.4.382.
Snaith RP, Harrop FM, Newby DA, Teale C. Grade scores of the Montgomery-Asberg Depression and the Clinical Anxiety Scales. Br J Psychiatry. 1986;148:599-601. doi: 10.1192/bjp.148.5.599.

Turkoz I, Alphs L, Singh J, Jamieson C, Daly E, Shawi M, et al. Clinically meaningful changes on depressive symptom measures and patient-reported outcomes in patients with treatment-resistant depression. J Affect Disord. 2021;281:267-273. doi: 10.1016/j.jad.2020.12.021.
formula: MADRS Score = Sum of all 10 items (each scored 0-6). Range: 0-60 points. Severity: Normal (0-6), Mild (7-19), Moderate (20-34), Severe (35-60).
notes: Designed to be sensitive to changes from antidepressant treatment
More sensitive to treatment-induced changes than Hamilton Depression Rating Scale
Each item scored 0-6: 0 = normal/absent, 6 = severe/continuous presence
Response to treatment defined as ≥50% reduction from baseline
Remission typically defined as score ≤7-9 points
Screening tool, not diagnostic - supplements clinical assessment
Focus on core mood symptoms rather than somatic symptoms
Widely used in clinical trials and practice for depression assessment
